heading: rocket crash
subheading: a russian rocket attempting to put a communications satellite in orbit went out of control and crashed shortly after lifting off from the baikonur cosmodrome in kazakhstan wednesday, the interfax news agency said. a source in the russian defense ministry told interfax that the rocket failed to fire completely and never managed to reach its intermediate orbit. it's the second crash of a russian proton rocket in four months.
author: wired staff
text: a russian rocket attempting to put a communications satellite in orbit went out of control and crashed shortly after lifting off from the baikonur cosmodrome in kazakhstan wednesday, the interfax news agency said. a source in the russian defense ministry told interfax that the rocket failed to fire completely and never managed to reach its intermediate orbit. it's the second crash of a russian proton rocket in four months.
